steps.title: Launch app – navigate to https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app (multiple flows)
details: Pages load but several UI-review checks already flag minor visual issues (typography, padding, colour contrast).

steps.title: Locate an existing task on the homepage
details: User can see task list but alignment of inputs/labels flagged as “looks off”.

steps.title: Mark task as completed (Task Completion flow)
details: Checkbox control not found, blocking completion, progress-bar and badge verification steps remain pending.

steps.title: Verify key homepage text for sharing flow
details: ‘Stay focused, stay productive.’ tagline not found; test times out. Subsequent share-feature steps never run.

steps.title: Wait for PWA install prompt
details: Prompt expected but small UI issues noted (button size, hierarchy).

steps.title: Accept PWA install prompt
details: Prompt element cannot be found; all offline-mode checks skipped.

steps.title: Observe default light theme
details: Loads as expected, colour contrast already flagged as low.

steps.title: Toggle dark mode
details: Dark-mode switch not discoverable; all later theme-customisation steps skipped.

steps.title: Open Transfer page for data import/export
details: Page loads, minor colour-contrast issue flagged.

steps.title: Click “Select JSON File” for import
details: Click intercepted by overlapping label; user cannot upload file via standard control. Remaining transfer-workflow steps pending.

steps.title: Open Add-Task page
details: Form fields visible but typography and spacing inconsistent.

steps.title: Submit empty form to trigger validation
details: Form submits, but visual alignment issues flagged.

steps.title: View validation messages
details: Expected ‘Task Description is required’ message not rendered, undermining form guidance. Subsequent task-creation steps skipped.

emotional_arc: Initial curiosity and confidence drop quickly to frustration as core controls (checkbox, dark-mode toggle, install prompt, file-upload button) fail to appear or respond. Each new feature exploration starts with hope but stalls at a missing or invisible UI element, compounding disappointment. Visual inconsistencies (spacing, contrast) subtly erode trust throughout. Overall feeling: increasing frustration, low confidence in reliability.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Missing / undiscoverable primary controls (checkbox, dark-mode toggle, share text, install prompt, file-upload)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: If essential actions are not rendered, users cannot complete key tasks, causing abandonment and negative perception.
next_actions: Audit DOM for conditional rendering logic; ensure elements mount for all viewport sizes and render states.
Add automated tests for presence of primary interactive elements.
Provide fallback text or alternative actions if advanced features are unsupported (e.g., PWA prompt).

qualitative_opportunities.area: Click interception & hit-area issues (file-upload label overlaps input, small buttons)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Pointer interception or tiny tappable areas block progression, especially on touch devices.
next_actions: Increase clickable area padding; use pointer-events CSS only when necessary.
Run accessibility tooling to highlight overlapped elements.
Add visual focus states to show what is actually clickable.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Visual consistency – typography, spacing, colour contrast
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent hierarchy and low contrast reduce readability and perceived polish, particularly for accessibility.
next_actions: Establish design tokens / style-guide and apply via global classes.
Run automated contrast checks; adjust palette to meet WCAG 2.1 AA.
Standardise spacing scale for forms and lists.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Missing or inconsistent error messages leave users unsure how to proceed, blocking conversion.
next_actions: Ensure all required fields surface inline error messages on blur/submit.
Add ARIA-live regions so assistive tech announces errors.
Include overview summary of missing fields above the form.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Progress & status visibility (progress bar, badge counts)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users rely on immediate feedback to confirm actions like task completion or offline sync.
next_actions: Update progress indicators via state management observable to avoid stale UI.
Introduce skeleton states or subtle animations to signal change.

first_tackles.description: Guarantee rendering and visibility of primary interactive elements (checkbox, dark-mode toggle, share tagline, install prompt, upload button).
Fix click interception and enlarge hit-areas for all buttons/inputs to ensure reliable interaction.
Implement consistent, accessible error messaging for all form validations (task creation, imports).
Improve colour contrast and typography using a shared design token system for quick visual uplift.
Add real-time UI feedback for progress indicators and badge counts once core interactions are reliable.
